summary: This is a modified version of the SkyrimEditor.ini file that will allow you to load the DLC's in the Skyrim Creation Kit
descriptionHtml:
This is a modified version of the SkyrimEditor.ini file that will allow you to load the DLC's in the Skyrim Creation Kit. This was used by me to create the mod "DLC Shrines in Skyrim Worldspace" (http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/74666/?), and I combined elements from five different forums and tutorials to do the right modifications in order for the ini-file to work properly, because of my earlier difficulties with making this work, I've decided to share my version of the SkyrimEditor.ini with you.


[size=5][b]Installation instructions (Important!!!)[/b]
[size=2]1. Only manual installation, no mod organizing tools can treat this as this is not a plugin!
2. Backup your SkyrimEditor.ini (SkyrimEditor) so that you can use that again of my ini-file does not work for you.
[/size][/size][size=2]3. Download[/size]

4. Copy/extract the SkyrimEditor.ini (or just SkyrimEditor, dending on your system) into the main Skyrim folder (not the Data folder!) (ProgramFilesx86/Steam/SteamApps/Common/Skyrim) - if you use Steam

5. Allow this file to replace your existing SkyrimEditor.ini (Don't worry, you have a backup, right?)

6. Launch you Skyrim Creation Kit and enjoy using resources from all the DLC's when you create mods.
[b]
[/b][size=4][b]Requirements[/b]
[size=2]1. All the official DLC's, Dawnguard, Dragonborn and Hearthfires, if you don't have all of them you must open the ini file, scroll down to the archive section, and remove any names where the DLC's you do not have are mentioned[/size][/size], or you could by the ones you don't have (That's what I would recommend ;p)

2. Skyrim Creation Kit - if you don't have this installed you should still have a copy if you bought this on Steam. CheckÂ  Libary/Tools (as this is a tool, not a game)

[i]
If you experience any issues, please let me know in the comments or send me a message. Also consider removing my ini-file and use your backup instead if my file causes problems.[/i]
author: Vaffelmannpingvinen
